moves.3. Bxh6: Not a very wise trade in the long run, as White will be in sore need of his black-squared Bishop, as he will soon find out.
moves.3... Bxh6: Though I didn't know it at the time, this Bishop placing is helpful.
moves.4. Nc3: Protecting the b2 square and developing a minor.
moves.5. e4 Bd7 6. a4 c5: The Queen is now free to pin the Knight.
moves.7. g4 Qa5: With this pin, the attack begins.
moves.8. Rc1: a3 would have been a better square for this Rook.
moves.8... Bxc1 9. Qxc1 Bxa4: I was conflicted as whether to play this before taking the Rook, but doing so may have led to a Queen trade, and I was NOT looking forward to playing without my Queen in this attack.
moves.10. Nge2: Double protectors on the c3 square.
moves.10... Nc6: Getting my Knight up there to hound at his Queen.
moves.11. Qd2: I didn't like this move very much.
moves.11... Nd4 12. Nc1: Not sure why this was played, exactly, so please comment if you can figure out why.
moves.12... Nf3+: The crippling royal fork. I didn't see this at first, and almost moved to the b3 square.
